result.execSummary:
The defendant John L Sheridan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Must seek work if unemployed or underemployed at 5 places per week and provide written log to Probation Agent and Child Support Agency monthly.

Must pay child support in full and on time each month through WI SCTF.
Must pay arrears in full and on time each month through WI SCTF.

Must report any change of address and/or employment to the Child Support Agency and Probation Agent within 48 hours.
Must submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John L Sheridan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John L Sheridan in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant John L Sheridan in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  VIS filed.  Defense and State waive PSI.  Guilty plea entered.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Discussion held regarding PSI.  Court finds Defendant has waived the PSI.  Attorney O'Hara relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence
Total length of sentence 3 years 6 months - STAYED
Initial Confinement 1 year 6 months
Extended Supervision 2 years 0 months
Is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

3 years Probation
90 days jail - Work release granted - Credit for 83 days
Must pay child support in full and on time each month
Must pay arrears in full and on time each month
Must obtain and maintain full-time employment
Must seek work if unemployed or underemployed at 5 places per week and provide written log to Probation Agent and Child Support Agency monthly
Must report any change of employment and/or address to the Child Support Agency and Probation Agent within 48 hours
Court costs including DNA surcharge
Must submit DNA sample
$1,365 extradition costs

Firearm and voting rights warning given.  WEDS given.

Defendant John L Sheridan in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant John L Sheridan in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No agreement.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Defendant John L Sheridan in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant John L Sheridan in custody.   Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

No agreement reached.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant John L Sheridan in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant John L Sheridan in custody.  Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
John Muench with child support agency present in court.
9:47  John Muench - Barron County Child Support Agency Director  called, sworn, direct by State
$13,235.99 owing.
9:49  cross by Attorney OHara
  Probable Cause Found and Bound Over 
  Information Filed.
  Plea of Not Guilty









FAX JAIL  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must not leave the State of Wisconsin without Court permission.

Defendant John L Sheridan in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant John L Sheridan in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to quash warrant.  Court orders warrant quashed.
Defendant waives reading of complaint and requests preliminary hearing.
  Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Body Only - Nationwide - Barron County will extradite
